item.title: Halpin Furniture Arklow
item.dc:creator: michael
item.content:encoded: Halpin's is one of the most trusted names in furniture in the South East. We have been in business for over 30 years and during that time we have gained a reputation for providing outstanding service, quality products and keen prices. At Halpin's you will find a fantastic selection of 3-piece suites, armchairs, reclining chairs, rugs and mattresses. Whatever it is you might need to survive a harsh winter, we are here to help. When you buy your new suite or bed at Halpin's, we will dispose of your old one for a nominal charge. We also provide free local delivery and assembly. Check our Facebook page to see our latest stock, or pop in and visit us in-store. Address: Dock rd, Arklow. Tel: 0402 39065 Email: info@halpinfurniture.ie Web: www.halpinfurniture.ie  [googlemap src="https://maps.google.ie/maps?q=dock+road+arklow++map&ie=UTF-8&hq=&hnear=0x4867c3f9a73d9121:0x448fe96edcf2e2f4,Dock+Rd,+Arklow,+Co.+Wicklow&gl=ie&ei=aW_VUt7sDsTG7AalnIDgAg&ved=0CC0Q8gEwAA" ]

item.title: Lifeline Homes debt management
item.dc:creator: michael
item.content:encoded: Lifeline homes is a debt management company which can assist with all types of personal debts, specialising in mortgage debt. We will negotiate on your behalf with the banks and financial institutions to reach a realistic repayment agreement or settlement. How Can Lifeline homes help me? We understand that it can be intimidating to deal with your financial service providers when you are in financial difficulties and facing mounting arrears. We can deal directly with these financial institutions on your behalf to try to come to a realistic payment proposal to keep you in your home, to try to reduce crippling debts to a more manageable level and to give you more time to reduce or clear your debt. We can take the pressure off you by dealing with all correspondence on your behalf and will keep you updated at every stage in the process. We can also negotiate to freeze or reduce the interest and penalties on your personal and mortgage debt. What if legal proceedings have already commenced? We can still help you if legal proceedings have commenced, we can help at any stage during the courts process even if the courts have made a possession order. We can also negotiate with the sheriff on your behalf.   We offer our services nationwide and can offer you a FREE no obligation consultation. We charge a small one off fee for our services, we do not charge you any ongoing monthly charges. To contact us for your free consultation please contact Eddie Colfer at 087-2683080or email us at info@lifelinehomes.ie

item.title: Co Wicklow Citizens Information Service
item.dc:creator: michael
item.content:encoded:
BRAY

3/4 The Boulevard Quinsboro Road, Bray Tel:  0761 07 6780 Fax: 01 2116699 email: bray@citinfo.ie Monday to Friday: 10.00am - 4.30pm Tuesdays: 7.30pm—9.30pm  

Specialist Services at Bray CIC

Employment Rights  Service Thurs 7.30pm—9.30pm by appointment BCAT Outreach Centre  2nd Tues of the month 3.00pm—5.00pm (members only) Free Legal Advice Tues 7.30pm -9.30pm by appointment CV Preparation/Typing and Interview Skills Service Thurs 7.30pm—9.30pm by appointment CAVA Thurs Evenings 7.30pm — 9.30pm by appointment Free Financial Advice Thurs 7.30pm—9.30pm by appointment Free Legal Advice 1st & 3rd  Wednesday of the month 7.00pm - 9.00pm by appointment. Chinese Information Service by appointment.

ARKLOW

73 Lower Main Street , Arklow Tel: 0761 07 6750  Fax: 0402 41202 email: arklow@citinfo.ie Mon, Tues, Wed & Thurs: 9.30am - 1.00pm; 2.00pm - 5.00pm Fri 9.30am - 1.00pm   Free Legal Advice 1st and 3rd Wednesday of the month 7.30pm-9.30pm by appointment. Polish Information Service Wed Evening, 6.00pm — 9.00 pm No appointment necessary    

WICKLOW  TOWN

9/10 Lower Mall email: wicklow@citinfo.ieTel: 0761 07 6840  Fax: (0404) 64967 Mon & Thurs 9.30am - 1.00pm & 2.00pm—5.00pm Tues, Wed & Fri 9.30am - 1.00pm   Free Legal Advice 1st and 3rd Wednesday of the month 7.30pm-9.30pm by appointment. Free Financial Advice 1st & 3rd Monday of the month 9.00am-11.00am by appointment   MABS (Money Advice & Budgeting Services) Wed 9.30am– 1.00pm by appointment     

BALTINGLASS OUTREACH CENTRE

Edward Street (Beside Borza Take-Away) Tel:  086 048 1880 Friday 10.00am - 2.00pm  

BLESSINGTON OUTREACH CENTRE

Blessington Library, Town Centre Tel: 086 048 1881 Tuesday 1.00pm—4.00pm  Wednesday 10.00am—12.30pm Free Legal Advice 1st & 3rd Tuesday of the month By appointment only 6.00pm—8.00pm  

GLENDALOUGH OUTREACH CENTRE

Brockagh Resource Centre Laragh, Glendalough Tel: 0404 45611 1st & 3rd Tuesday of month 10.00am - 12 noon  

Sunbeam House Services Outreach

Last Wednesday of the month 11.00am to 1.00pm (Service users only)  

National Advocacy Service  (NAS)

Mon — Wicklow CIC Tues — Arklow CIC Wed, Thurs & Fri — Bray CIC Contact: Patty O’Malley Tel: 086 806 5641 Email: patty.omalley@advocacy.ie  

Visit our website:

www.citizensinformation.ie

Tel: 0761 07 4000

item.title: In Business: The Chiropractor, Wicklow Town
item.dc:creator: michael
item.content:encoded: Since opening his chiropractic clinic in Wicklow Town almost two years ago, Vincent Pippet has experienced the growing pains of starting a new business. “Any start-up is challenging,” he said. “It’s time consuming – doing the paperwork, trying to get a website sorted, finding a premises – and none of it is free. That is definitely a challenge.” Vincent has brought a strong sporting and fitness background to his new profession, having worked extensively in fitness industry and representing Ireland in squash, a sport he also coached. Vincent also has a long history with the chiropractic profession and was once on the receiving end of the treatment. “I had my own back problems in the past. I’d been to see chiropractors and decided to go back and study to be one.” After earning a degree in Sports Science, Vincent has now gone on to further his study to become a fully qualified chiropractor. Vincent has been delighted with the response he has received from members of the public and says working for himself is hugely motivating. “The job satisfaction is excellent, and being able to do it in my own town is really, really satisfying. You’re helping people from all walks of life. Some people might have a disc problem, some people might have whiplash, and some might want to improve their sports performance. It’s a broad spectrum of people, and a really rewarding job.” Vincent’s clinic, The Chiropractor, is based in the Wicklow Enterprise Centre on the Murrough in Wicklow Town. The enterprise centre provides entrepreneurs like Vincent with facilities and expertise to help their business along in the early stages of development. “The Wicklow County Enterprise Board has been great in giving me help,” Vincent said. “Look after the people who are good enough to support you, because they’re the most important thing. Word of mouth is the strongest referral you’ll ever get.” As well as a range of chiropractic services, The Chirpractor also offers free drop-in clinics on Tuesday mornings when people can come to have their ailments assessed.   If you would like your business profiled on WicklowNews.net, please contact news@wicklownews.net

item.title: Lose 2 stone in 10 weeks with System10
item.dc:creator: michael
item.content:encoded:
Opening Hours 

Bray Clinic

Unit 8, Bray South Business Park, Killarney Road, Bray

(Beside East Coast FM)

Mon, Fri and Sat from 10am

Wednesday Evening clinic from 4pm

 

Arklow Clinic

30, Lower Main Street, Arklow (on Abbey Lane)

Friday/Saturday from 10am

item.title: Sinnott Autos — A friendly face for 30 years
item.dc:creator: michael
item.content:encoded: From the very first time the doors opened, 30 years ago, Sinnott Autos has been a friendly face serving the community. Sinnott's have remained committed to providing the highest possible levels of quality, professionalism and excellent service to their customers. As a direct result of the loyalty of their customers over the years, today Sinnott's are proud to have a customer base that not only includes Wicklow, but has extended to include people from South Dublin and Wexford. In 1987, Sinnott's opened a small petrol station and dealership, which has now developed into a highly awarded and recognised company. In 2011, Paul and John Sinnott expanded into a second car dealership, establishing Sinnott Skoda. Aiming to provide the level of service provided by their Volkswagen showroom, their Skoda venture has had the honour of becoming one of the largest Skoda dealerships in Ireland. As acknowledgement of the vital role the community has played in the company's success, Sinnott Autos have been enthusiastic in providing sponsorship and support to local clubs and community events, like the Wicklow Regatta or St. Patrick's Day Parade. The majority of their employees have been working with the Company for over ten years, with some of them being a part of the Sinnott Autos family since the 90's. Originally a team of three working alongside the Sinnott family, it has now grown to over 40 employees that continue the tradition of providing a consistently exceptional service. The team receive regular training to make sure they retain a high level of proficiency and expertise.   Sinnott Autos Ltd, Wicklow Town, Co. Wicklow (0404) 25200 info@sinnottautos.ie www.sinnottautos.ie

item.title: Intupod — a unique, luxury accommodation experience — seeks joint venture partners
item.dc:creator: michael
item.content:encoded:
Intupod are seeking joint venture partners — particularly accommodation providers or landowners/farmers — who wish to create new holiday experiences

Intupod are Ireland's only manufacturer of aluminium accommodation pods which are designed to provide a luxurious and unique accommodation experience. The company recently held a very successful information session in Coleraine, Northern Ireland and have now planned three sessions in Wicklow. To attend an information session, which are being held at the Glenview Hotel, please follow the links below:
  • Wednesday 21st February 1.30-4.30
  • Thursday 22nd February 9.30 – 12.30
  • Thursday 22nd February 1.30 – 4.30.
https://intupod.com/

item.title: Jobs Guide 11/10/2019
item.dc:creator: Liamdoyle
item.content:encoded:
Are you looking for a change? We've got the scoop on the latest job opportunities from all around Wicklow.

Building Staff Solutions (BSS) is seeking a Junior Project Manager to work in Wicklow for and expanding Building Contractor with Commercial, Residential and Public Build Projects. This will be a great opportunity for a Civil Engineer with 5 years experience to take on a management role that will have real progression opportunities, training and support.

To apply, please contact Michael on 01 707 1012.

Autism Initiatives are seeking a Senior Social Care Worker (Stillorgan) & Acting Senior Social Care Worker (Ashford). Candidates must have a degree in social care, social science, phsycotherapy, or phsycology. Candidates must also have a full and clean driver's licence as well as other experience.

Closing date for applications is Tuesday the 22nd of October.

Please send your application to asdirecruitment@asdi.ie.

item.title: One-Stop-Shop Home Retrofit Service
item.dc:creator: michael
item.content:encoded:
Are you looking to upgrade to warmer, easier-to-heat, more energy-efficient home?

Wicklow Town based Donovan Low Energy are asking homeowners in the Wicklow area who wish to upgrade this Winter or in Spring 2021 to get in touch to arrange a free home energy assessment and estimate. The assessment forms part of their One-Stop-Shop Retrofit service in which all aspects of a home energy upgrade are managed by Donovan Low Energy – from initial appraisal and grant application through to site management of works and final sign-off and grant drawdown.

The service is focused on homeowners who wish to substantially improve the comfort levels and energy efficiency of their home,with homes achieving a post-works BER of B2 or better. Measures covered include insulation, draught-proofing, heat pumps, heating controls, windows & doors, ventilation systems and solar PV.

With a combined experience of over 30 years in energy assessment and project management, Donovan Low Energy understand the simple and practical improvements that make homes more comfortable, more energy efficient and more affordable to run. Launching their new One-Stop-Shop service, SEAI-Registered Retrofit Project Manager David O’Donovan commented: “With many of us working from home now, there has never been a better time to make our homes more comfortable and with increased funding from government and low-cost finance available, retrofitting is now a sound investment for both our pockets and the environment."

Interested homeowners should visit www.donovanlowenergy.ie/homeowners and fill out the form or alternatively they can contact David on (087) 0542605 or by email at david@donovanlowenergy.ie
